structure.comment: The different levels at which this subscription can be obtained. There can be price differences between regions, price differences for different durations (e.g. monthly is more expensive than yearly
structure.name: productSubscriptionLevel

field.comment: The VAT exclusive base price for this level. Sometimes you want to set a base fee for the level, regardless of the amount of units (obviously within the unit limits though)
field.name: basePrice

field.comment: Per additional unit you add (within the range), you pay this in addition. This can obviously just be a factor of the baseprice. But sometimes you want a baseline price (e.g. 5€) and an additional 1€ per unit. In most cases you will only have a unit price
field.name: unitPrice

field.comment: If filled in, this is the currency that the price is expressed in. If not filled in, we check region. If not filled in, we assume a default for your application.
field.name: currencyId

field.comment: Optionally you can scope it to a region (e.g. country, europe,...). Otherwise whatever currency is available in the country will be used
field.name: paymentRegionId

field.comment: The minimum amount of a certain "product" you have to consume to get this level. For instance if you buy a subscription for a 1000 units, you might pay different prices than for 1 unit
field.name: minimumUnitAmount

field.comment: The maximum amount of a certain "product" you have to consume to get this level. For instance if you buy a subscription for a 1000 units, you might pay different prices than for 1 unit
field.name: maximumUnitAmount

field.comment: You can't delete levels because of foreign keys, so soft delete
field.name: enabled
